qas.question: When did Slavs appear on Byzantine borders?
The Slavs appeared on whose borders around the 6th century?
Where had the Slavs settled by the end of the 6th century?
When had the Slavs settled the Eastern Alps?

answers.text: By the end of the 6th century

qas.question: When did the Peloponnese appear on Byzantine borders?
What did Slav records note could not grow after their presence?
Where were Slave settled at the beginning of the 6th century?
How has the southern movement of the Byzantine empire been understood?
Where did the Peloponnese appear at the beginning of the 6th c?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Around the 6th century<b5_0/><a0_0/>, Slavs appeared on <a1_0><b9_0>Byzantine borders<b9_0/><a1_0/> in great numbers.[page needed] The Byzantine records note that <b6_0>grass<b6_0/> would not regrow in places where the Slavs had marched through, so great were their numbers. After a military movement even the <a2_0>Peloponnese and Asia Minor<a2_0/> were reported to have Slavic settlements. This southern movement has traditionally been seen <b8_0>as an invasive expansion<b8_0/>. <a4_0>By the end of the 6th century<a4_0/>, Slavs had settled <a3_0><b7_0>the Eastern Alps<a3_0/> regions<b7_0/>.
